City Council
============

Meetings
--------

* Times posted on the agenda
* 1st and 3rd Tuesday of every month or as needed
* City Hall Annex  
  101 E Main Street  
  Forney, TX 75126

2026 Meeting Dates
------------------

* [2026 Meeting Schedule](https://www.forneytx.gov/DocumentCenter/View/9572/2026-Council-Meeting-Schedule---As-of-11-20-2025)

Council meetings are open to the public as provided by the Open Meetings Act (Government Code, Chapter 551). The Forney City Council, along with all other councils and commissions within the City are administered through rules and procedures approved by the City Council. Those [rules and procedures](https://www.forneytx.gov/DocumentCenter/View/9047/O24-51-Amending-Rules-of-Procedure) are linked on the website.

Agendas & Minutes
-----------------

Agendas are available prior to the meetings. Minutes are available following approval.

[View Most Recent Agendas and Minutes](https://www.forneytx.gov/AgendaCenter/City-Council-1)

Overview
--------

The City Council establishes other rules of meeting procedure and are not subject to Roberts Rules of Order, although the council follows a similar procedure. The City Council may act by ordinance, resolution, or motion.

### Terms

City Council members are elected for staggered 3-year terms.

### Place Number

While the City Council is elected by place number, the number is for candidacy purposes only and each member represents the entire population of Forney.

### Responsibilities

Among other authorities granted by state law and the Home Rule Charter adopted by the citizens of Forney, the City Council:

* Adopts the annual budget
* Annexes property into the city limits
* Appoints the [City Manager](https://www.forneytx.gov/172/City-Manager), [City Secretary](https://www.forneytx.gov/173/City-Secretary), City Attorney, and [Municipal Court Judges](https://www.forneytx.gov/241/Municipal-Court)
* Approves certain city expenditures
* Awards contracts and bids
* Establishes development standards
* Makes appointments to boards and committees
* Regulates zoning
* Sets the annual property tax rate for the City of Forney

Winter Storm Warning

Forney is under a winter storm warning from 6 p.m. Friday to noon CST Sunday. Ice, sleet, and snow are likely to begin on Friday evening and continue through Sunday morning. Current forecasts for the DFW area call for 2â€“4 inches of sleet and snow, along with up to Â½ inch of ice. TxDOT crews are pretreating interstates ahead of the storm. Forney Public Works crews are also prepared to treat city roads and priority intersections as conditions warrant.

TxDOT crews are pretreating interstates ahead of the storm. Forney Public Works crews are also prepared to treat city roads and priority intersections as conditions warrant.

**How to Prepare:**

* Protect people, pets, pipes, and plants
* Allow indoor faucets to drip and open cabinet doors
* Cover exterior pipes and faucets
* Charge phones and battery packs

**Stay Informed:**

**What Not to Do:**

* Travel on icy roads unless necessary
* Leave pets outside in extreme cold
* Never run generators, grills, or propane heaters indoors or in garages

More information: <https://www.forneytx.gov/1046/Preparing-for-Cold-Weather-Information-a>
